root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Broadcasting (Listed Sporting Events) (Scotland): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to expand the list of sporting events that must be made available for broadcast by free-to-air television channels to include all qualifying matches played by the Scotland men’s and women’s national football teams in the World Cup and the UEFA European Football Championship; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: OFFSHORE PETROLEUM LICENSING BILL: COMMITTEE AND REMAINING STAGES
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to four hours after the commencement of proceedings in Committee of the whole House (Order of 8 January)

from_cdata.p:
Proceedings in Committee of the whole House shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion three hours after their commencement. Any proceedings on Consideration and proceedings on Third Reading shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion four hours after the commencement of proceedings in Committee of the whole House (Order of 8 January).
For amendments, see separate paper (also available on the documents webpage for the Bill).

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Mesothelioma Lump Sum Payments (Conditions and Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 11 January, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Pneumoconiosis etc. (Workers’ Compensation) (Specified Diseases and Prescribed Occupations) (Amendment) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 14 December 2023, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Pneumoconiosis etc. (Workers’ Compensation) (Payment of Claims) (Amendment) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 11 January, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

root.MotionSponsor: Sir Bill Wiggin, ,on behalf of the Committee of Selection

MotionText.from_cdata: That Rob Butler be discharged from the Justice Committee.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 7.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Government support for walking and cycling: Trudy Harrison
root.DebateTimingRubric: The first part of the sitting will last for two hours. The second part of the sitting will last for three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
root.MotionText: That this House has considered the potential merits of a register of not-in-school children: Mrs Flick Drummond
That this House has considered human rights in Balochistan, Pakistan: John McDonnell

from_cdata.p: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30am to 2.30pm.

root.MotionText: That this House has considered the matter of tackling off-road biking: Peter Gibson
That this House has considered the matter of robbery and theft in Carshalton and Wallington constituency: Elliot Colburn
That this House has considered Government support for young drivers: Carla Lockhart

p.span: The debate at 4.30pm will last for up to an hour.

p.span: The sitting will be suspended and time added if divisions take place in the main Chamber (Standing Order No. 10(3)).
